item.title: Help with pickup command
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Well, I’m sorry he didn’t specify his protocol.

That’s not my fault, it’s his.

There are many topics among the board telling people to post the revision and base.[/quote]
Haha, no worrys. I know it’s not your fault. I was just pointing out that he’s not using a 317 base. Sorry if you thought I was flaming you or sum’ shit.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with pickup command
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Also, the method was for a 317.

Just because the variables and packaging is different, doesn’t change the revision.[/quote]
Also, he wasn’t using a 317.

That’s just like giving someone non-compatible code and telling them that it’s exactly the same you just have to change almost everything to get it to work.

Also, even if he did change almost everything to make it work, it still would have removed economyItems (what ever the fuck they are) and his wildernessZone check.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with pickup command
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

Yes. Inside the Command class but outside of any method for example.

public class ExampleClass {
    /* You would declare your public variables here.*/
    public int[] someArray = {};    

    public void exampleMethod() {
        /* Not here, this is wrong.*/
        public int[] thisArrayIsWrong = {};
    }
}

Read full topic

item.title: Help with pickup command
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

if (cmd[0].equals("item")) {
    if (p.rights <= 0) {
        for (int i = 0; i < p.economyItems.length; i++) {
            if (Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]) == p.economyItems[i]) {
                p.getActionSender().sendMessage(p, p.getMessageString(Integer.parseInt(cmd[1])));
                return;
            }
        }
        for (int noSpawn : cantSpawn) {
            if (Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]) == noSpawn) {
                p.getActionSender().sendMessage(p, "You can't spawn this.");
                return;
            }
        }
        if (p.wildernessZone(p.absX, p.absY)) {
            p.getActionSender().sendMessage(p, "You cannot spawn items in the wilderness.");
            return;
         }
     }
     Engine.playerItems.addItem(p, Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]), Integer.parseInt(cmd[2]));
}

Just a guess. I mean logically it should work. You just also need to declare this variable.

public int[] cantSpawn = {/* ID's go here*/};

PS: @I Vain I, You realise that’s not a 317 right?

Read full topic

item.title: Help with pickup command
item.dc:creator: @Nathan8888 Nathan8888
item.description:
@Nathan8888 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”] if (command.startsWith("item") && playerRights > 1) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if (args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); for(int element : noSpawn) { if(element == newItemID) { sM("You may not spawn this item."); return; } } if (newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } }
And:

public int[] noSpawn = {ID, ID, ID, ID, ID};

Credits to Deathschaos9.[/quote]

Doesnt work -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Help with pickup command
item.dc:creator: @Nathan8888 Nathan8888
item.description:
@Nathan8888 wrote:

Ok i want to make it so you cant pickup certain items like ags bandos etc… Please help me
Here is my pickup code

if (cmd[0].equals("item")) { if (p.rights <= 0) { for (int i = 0; i < p.economyItems.length; i++) { if (Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]) == p.economyItems[i]) { p.getActionSender().sendMessage(p, p.getMessageString(Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]))); return; } } if (p.wildernessZone(p.absX, p.absY)) { p.getActionSender().sendMessage(p, "You cannot spawn items in the wilderness."); return; } } Engine.playerItems.addItem(p, Integer.parseInt(cmd[1]), Integer.parseInt(cmd[2])); }

Read full topic
